questions.question: Which of the given statements are correct about a stuck-at fault model ?

answers.a: It is used to mimic manufacturing defect within a circuit
answers.b: Individual signals can be stuck at logical '0' or '1'
answers.c: They can always be detected in a circuit

explanations.d: The stuck-at fault model is used to simulate manufacturing defects where individual signals are stuck at either logical '0' or '1', but detection may not always be guaranteed in all circuits.

questions.question: Can an encoder be a transducer?

answers.d: Both are not even related slightly

explanations.a: An encoder can be a transducer because it converts one form of data (e.g., decimal input) into another form (e.g., binary output), which is the function of a transducer.

questions.question: Stuck-At 0 Fault at a particular point in a circuit can be implemented using ______________.

explanations.c: A Stuck-at-0 fault at a particular point in a circuit can be implemented using an AND gate, as it ensures the output remains at logic 0 when one of the inputs is stuck at 0.

questions.question: The number of OR gates used in a 4-input priority encoder is ______________.

explanations.c: A 4-input priority encoder typically uses 3 OR gates to combine the necessary input signals and determine the encoded output based on priority.

questions.question: What happens to the logic of a wire initially at logic 1 when passing through two SA0 faults?

answers.a: Becomes 0 after the first SA0 fault and remains 0 after the second SA0 fault
answers.c: Changes to 0 after the first SA0 fault and again changes to 1 after the second SA0 fault
answers.d: Remains 1 after the first SA0 fault and changes to 0 after the second SA0 fault

explanations.a: A Stuck-at-0 (SA0) fault forces the signal to 0, and once a wire is stuck at 0, it remains 0 even if it passes through additional SA0 faults.
